description: a(1)=p_1, a(2)=p_1 + p_1*p_2, a(3)=p_1 + p_1*p_2 + p_1*p_2*p_3, ... where p_i is the i-th prime.
comments: Partial sums of the primorials A002110 starting from 2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 05 2014All terms are even. From a(98) on, all terms are multiples of 523. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 05 2014
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
maple: for n from 1 to 30 do printf(`%d,`,sum(product(ithprime(i), i=1..j), j=1..n)) od:
prog: (PARI) a(n)=my(s,P=1); forprime(p=2,prime(n),s+=P*=p); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 05 2014
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Apr 04 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 05 2001
